verses.verse: As snow <S%H7950><s%> in summer <S%H7019><s%>, and as rain <S%H4306><s%> in harvest <S%H7105><s%>, so honour <S%H3519><s%> is not seemly <S%H5000><s%> for a fool <S%H3684><s%>.
As the bird <S%H6833><s%> by wandering <S%H5110><s%>, as the swallow <S%H1866><s%> by flying <S%H5774><s%>, so the curse <S%H7045><s%> causeless <S%H2600><s%> shall not come <S%H935><s%>.
A whip <S%H7752><s%> for the horse <S%H5483><s%>, a bridle <S%H4964><s%> for the ass <S%H2543><s%>, and a rod <S%H7626><s%> for the fool's <S%H3684><s%> back <S%H1460><s%>.
Answer <S%H6030><s%> not a fool <S%H3684><s%> according to his folly <S%H200><s%>, lest thou also be like <S%H7737><s%> unto him.
Answer <S%H6030><s%> a fool <S%H3684><s%> according to his folly <S%H200><s%>, lest he be wise <S%H2450><s%> in his own conceit <S%H5869><s%>. conceit: Heb. eyes

He that sendeth <S%H7971><s%> a message <S%H1697><s%> by the hand <S%H3027><s%> of a fool <S%H3684><s%> cutteth off <S%H7096><s%> the feet <S%H7272><s%>, and drinketh <S%H8354><s%> damage <S%H2555><s%>. damage: or, violence
The legs <S%H7785><s%> of the lame <S%H6455><s%> are not equal <S%H1809><s%>: so is a parable <S%H4912><s%> in the mouth <S%H6310><s%> of fools <S%H3684><s%>. are: Heb. are lifted up

As he that bindeth <S%H6872><s%> <S%H6887><s%> a stone <S%H68><s%> in a sling <S%H4773><s%>, so is he that giveth <S%H5414><s%> honour <S%H3519><s%> to a fool <S%H3684><s%>. bindeth: or, putteth a precious stone in an heap of stones
As a thorn <S%H2336><s%> goeth up <S%H5927><s%> into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of a drunkard <S%H7910><s%>, so is a parable <S%H4912><s%> in the mouth <S%H6310><s%> of fools <S%H3684><s%>.

The great <S%H7227><s%> God that formed <S%H2342><s%> all things both rewardeth <S%H7936><s%> the fool <S%H3684><s%>, and rewardeth <S%H7936><s%> transgressors <S%H5674><s%>. The great: or, A great man grieveth all, and he hireth the fool, he hireth also transgressors
As a dog <S%H3611><s%> returneth <S%H7725><s%> to his vomit <S%H6892><s%>, so a fool <S%H3684><s%> returneth <S%H8138><s%> to his folly <S%H200><s%>. returneth to his folly: Heb. iterateth his folly
Seest <S%H7200><s%> thou a man <S%H376><s%> wise <S%H2450><s%> in his own conceit <S%H5869><s%>? there is more hope <S%H8615><s%> of a fool <S%H3684><s%> than of him.
The slothful <S%H6102><s%> man saith <S%H559><s%>, There is a lion <S%H7826><s%> in the way <S%H1870><s%>; a lion <S%H738><s%> is in the streets <S%H7339><s%>.
As the door <S%H1817><s%> turneth <S%H5437><s%> upon his hinges <S%H6735><s%>, so doth the slothful <S%H6102><s%> upon his bed <S%H4296><s%>.

The slothful <S%H6102><s%> hideth <S%H2934><s%> his hand <S%H3027><s%> in his bosom <S%H6747><s%>; it grieveth <S%H3811><s%> him to bring it again <S%H7725><s%> to his mouth <S%H6310><s%>. it grieveth: or, he is weary
The sluggard <S%H6102><s%> is wiser <S%H2450><s%> in his own conceit <S%H5869><s%> than seven men <S%H7651><s%> that can render <S%H7725><s%> a reason <S%H2940><s%>.

He that passeth by <S%H5674><s%>, and meddleth <S%H5674><s%> with strife <S%H7379><s%> belonging not to him, is like one that taketh <S%H2388><s%> a dog <S%H3611><s%> by the ears <S%H241><s%>. meddleth: or, is enraged
As a mad <S%H3856><s%> man who casteth <S%H3384><s%> firebrands <S%H2131><s%>, arrows <S%H2671><s%>, and death <S%H4194><s%>, firebrands: Heb. flames, or, sparks
So is the man <S%H376><s%> that deceiveth <S%H7411><s%> his neighbour <S%H7453><s%>, and saith <S%H559><s%>, Am not I in sport <S%H7832><s%>?

Where no <S%H657><s%> wood <S%H6086><s%> is, there the fire <S%H784><s%> goeth out <S%H3518><s%>: so where there is no talebearer <S%H5372><s%>, the strife <S%H4066><s%> ceaseth <S%H8367><s%>. Where no: Heb. Without wood talebearer: or, whisperer ceaseth: Heb. is silent

As coals <S%H6352><s%> are to burning coals <S%H1513><s%>, and wood <S%H6086><s%> to fire <S%H784><s%>; so is a contentious <S%H4079><s%> <S%H4066><s%> man <S%H376><s%> to kindle <S%H2787><s%> strife <S%H7379><s%>.

The words <S%H1697><s%> of a talebearer <S%H5372><s%> are as wounds <S%H3859><s%>, and they go down <S%H3381><s%> into the innermost parts <S%H2315><s%> of the belly <S%H990><s%>. innermost: Heb. chambers
Burning <S%H1814><s%> lips <S%H8193><s%> and a wicked <S%H7451><s%> heart <S%H3820><s%> are like a potsherd <S%H2789><s%> covered <S%H6823><s%> with silver <S%H3701><s%> dross <S%H5509><s%>.
He that hateth <S%H8130><s%> dissembleth <S%H5234><s%> with his lips <S%H8193><s%>, and layeth up <S%H7896><s%> deceit <S%H4820><s%> within <S%H7130><s%> him; dissembleth: or, is known

When he speaketh <S%H6963><s%> fair <S%H2603><s%>, believe <S%H539><s%> him not: for there are seven <S%H7651><s%> abominations <S%H8441><s%> in his heart <S%H3820><s%>. speaketh: Heb. maketh his voice gracious
Whose hatred <S%H8135><s%> is covered <S%H3680><s%> by deceit <S%H4860><s%>, his wickedness <S%H7451><s%> shall be shewed <S%H1540><s%> before the whole congregation <S%H6951><s%>. by: or, in secret
Whoso diggeth <S%H3738><s%> a pit <S%H7845><s%> shall fall <S%H5307><s%> therein: and he that rolleth <S%H1556><s%> a stone <S%H68><s%>, it will return <S%H7725><s%> upon him.

A lying <S%H8267><s%> tongue <S%H3956><s%> hateth <S%H8130><s%> those that are afflicted <S%H1790><s%> by it; and a flattering <S%H2509><s%> mouth <S%H6310><s%> worketh <S%H6213><s%> ruin <S%H4072><s%>.
